arabicText: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍۢ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
He	 created	 the	 heavens	and	 the	earth	with	 the	 truth;	Supreme	is	He	above	 their	ascribing	 of	
partners	(to	Him).
romanUrduTranslationText: Usne	āasmān		aur	zamin	bajā	banāye	woh	un	ke	shirk	se	bartar	hai.

arabicText: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍۢ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText: He	created	man	from	a	drop	of	fluid,	yet	he	is	an	open	quarreller!
romanUrduTranslationText: (us	ne)	Ādmi		ko	ek	nithri	booñd	se	banāyā	to	jabhi	khulā	jhagdāloo	hai.

arabicText: وَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمَ خَلَقَهَا ۗ لَكُمْ فِيهَا دِفْءٌۭ وَمَنَـٰفِعُ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	He	created	cattle;	in	them	are	warm	clothing	and	uses	for	you,	and	you	eat	from	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	chaupāye	paidā	kiye	un	meiñ	tumhāre	liye	garam	libās	aur	manf’ateiñ	haiñ	aur	un	meiñ	se	
khāte	ho.

arabicText: وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا جَمَالٌ حِينَ تُرِيحُونَ وَحِينَ تَسْرَحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	in	them	is	your	elegance,	when	you	bring	them	home	at	evening,	and	when	you	leave	them	
to	graze.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhārā	un	meiñ	tajammul	hai	jab	unheñ	shām	ko	wāpas	lāte	ho	aur	jab	charne	ko	chodte	
ho

arabicText: وَتَحْمِلُ أَثْقَالَكُمْ إِلَىٰ بَلَدٍۢ لَّمْ تَكُونُوا۟ بَـٰلِغِيهِ إِلَّا بِشِقِّ ٱلْأَنفُسِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 transport	 your	 loads	 to	 a	 town	
where	you	could	not	reach	except	utterly	
exhausted;	 indeed	 your	 Lord	 is	 Most	
Compassionate,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	tumhāre	bojh	uthā	kar	le	jāte	haiñ	
aise	 shaher	 ki	 ṭaraf	 ke	 tum	 us	 tak	 na	
pahuñchte	magar	adh	mare	ho	kar	be-shak		
tumhārā	 Rab	 nihāyat	 maherbān raham	
wālā	hai

arabicText: وَٱلْخَيْلَ وَٱلْبِغَالَ وَٱلْحَمِيرَ لِتَرْكَبُوهَا وَزِينَةًۭ ۚ وَيَخْلُقُ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 horses,	 and	 mules,	 and	 donkeys	 so	
that	 you	 may	 ride	 them,	 and	 for	
adornment;	and	He	will	create	what	you	do	
not	 know	 *.	 (*	 All	 modern	 means	 of	
transport	 - by	 air,	 sea,	 land	 and	 even	 in	
space	- evidence	this.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ghode	aur	khachchar	aur	gadhe	ke	in	
par	 sawār	 ho	 aur	 zinat	 ke	 liye	 aur	 woh	
paidā	karega	jis	ki	tumheñ	khabar	nahiñ

arabicText: وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ قَصْدُ ٱلسَّبِيلِ وَمِنْهَا جَآئِرٌۭ ۚ وَلَوْ شَآءَ لَهَدَىٰكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	middle	path	rightly	leads	to	Allah
- any	other	path	is	wayward;	and	had	He	
willed	 He	 would	 have	 brought	 all	 of	 you	
upon	guidance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	beech	ki	rāh	theek	Allāh	tak	hai	aur	koi	
rāh	tedhi	hai	aur	chāhtā	to	tum	sab	ko	rāh	
par	lātā

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ ۖ لَّكُم مِّنْهُ شَرَابٌۭ وَمِنْهُ شَجَرٌۭ فِيهِ تُسِيمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	sent	down	water	from	the	sky	
- you	 drink	 from	it,	and	 from	it	are	 trees	
you	use	as	pasture.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	wohi		hai	jis	ne	āasmān		se	pāni	utārā	
is	se	tumhārā	peenā	hai	aur	is	se	darakht	
haiñ	jin	se	charāte	ho

arabicText: يُنۢبِتُ لَكُم بِهِ ٱلزَّرْعَ وَٱلزَّيْتُونَ وَٱلنَّخِيلَ وَٱلْأَعْنَـٰبَ وَمِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
With	this	water	He	produces	for	you	crops,	
and	 olives,	and	dates,	and	grapes, and	all	
kinds	 of	 fruit;	indeed	in	 this	is	 a	 sign	 for	
people	who	ponder.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Is	pani	se	tumhāre	liye	kheti	ugātā	hai	aur	
zaitoon	aur	khajoor	aur	angoor	aur	har	qism	ke	phal	be-shak is	meiñ	nishāni	hai	dhiyān	karne	
wāloñ	ko

arabicText: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ وَٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ ۖ وَٱلنُّجُومُ مُسَخَّرَٰتٌۢ بِأَمْرِهِۦٓ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	He	subjected	the	night	and	the	day	for	
you	- and	 the	sun	and	 the	moon;	and	 the	
stars	are	subjected	to	His	command;	indeed	in	this	are	signs	for	people	of	intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ne	tumhāre	liye	musakhkhar	(tābe’)	kiye	rāt	aur din	aur	sooraj	aur	chāñd	aur	sitāre	us	ke	
hukm	ke	bāñdhe	haiñ	be-shak		is	meiñ	nishaniyāñ	haiñ	‘aqlmandoñ	ko

arabicText: وَمَا ذَرَأَ لَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَٰنُهُۥٓ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	things	He	has	created	for	you	in	the	earth,	of	numerous	colours;	indeed	in	this	is	a	sign	
for	people	who	remember.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	tumhāre	liye	zamin	meiñ	paidā	kiyā	rang	birang	be-shak is	meiñ	nishāni	hai	yād	karne	
wāloñ	ko

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى سَخَّرَ ٱلْبَحْرَ لِتَأْكُلُوا۟ مِنْهُ لَحْمًۭا طَرِيًّۭا وَتَسْتَخْرِجُوا۟ مِنْهُ حِلْيَةًۭ تَلْبَسُونَهَا وَتَرَى ٱلْفُلْكَ مَوَاخِرَ فِيهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	subjected	the	sea	for	you,	so	you	eat	fresh	meat	from	it,	and	extract	ornaments	
from	it	which	you	wear;	and	you	see	ships	ploughing	through	it	and	in	order	that	you	may	seek	
His	munificence	and	that	you	may	give	thanks.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Wohi		hai	jis	ne	tumhāre	liye	dariyā	musakhkhar	kiyā	us	meiñ	se	tāza	gosht	khāte	ho	aur	us	
meiñ	se	gahnā	(zewar)	nikālte	ho	jise	pahente	ho	aur	tu	us	meiñ	kashtiyāñ	dekhe	ke	pāni	cheer	
kar	chalti	haiñ	aur	is	liye	ke	tum	us	kā	fazl	talāsh	karo	aur	kahiñ	ehsān	māno

arabicText: وَأَلْقَىٰ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ رَوَٰسِىَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِكُمْ وَأَنْهَـٰرًۭا وَسُبُلًۭا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	He	placed	mountains	as	anchors	in	the	
earth	so	that	it	may	not	shake	along	with	
you,	and	streams	and	roads	for	you	to	find	
course.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Us	ne	zamin	meiñ	langar	dāle	ke	kahiñ	
tumheñ	 lekar	 na	 kāñpe	 aur	 nadiyāñ	 aur	
raste	ke	tum	rāh	pāo

arabicText: وَعَلَـٰمَـٰتٍۢ ۚ وَبِٱلنَّجْمِ هُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	landmarks;	and	they	are	guided	by	the	
star.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 álāmateñ	 aur	 sitāre	 se	 woh	 rāh	 pāte	
haiñ

arabicText: أَفَمَن يَخْلُقُ كَمَن لَّا يَخْلُقُ ۗ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	 will	 He	 Who	 creates	 ever	 be	 like	 one	
who	does	not	create?	So	do	you	not	heed	
advice?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kyā	jo	banāye	woh	aisā	ho	jāye	gā	jo	na	
banāye	to	kyā	tum	nasihat	nahiñ	mānte

arabicText: وَإِن تَعُدُّوا۟ نِعْمَةَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَآ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَغَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	you	enumerate	the	favours	of	Allah,	
you	 will	 never	 be	 able	 to	 count	 them;	
indeed	 Allah is	 Oft	 Forgiving,	 Most	
Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	Allāh	ki	ne’mateñ	gino	 to	unheñ	
shumār	 na	 kar	 sakoge	 be-shak	 	 Allāh	
bakhsh	ne	wālā	maherbān		hai

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُسِرُّونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 Allah knows	 what	 you	 conceal	 and	
what	you	disclose.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Allāh	 jāntā	 hai	 jo	 chupāte	 aur	 zahir	
karte	ho.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ لَا يَخْلُقُونَ شَيْـًۭٔا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 those	 (idols)	 whom	 they	 worship	
other	 than	 Allah,	 do	 not	 create	 anything	
but	are	themselves	created.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	 ke	 siwā	jin	 ko	 poojte	 haiñ	woh	
kuchh	 	 bhi	 nahiñ	 banāte	 aur	 woh	 khud	
banāye	huye	haiñ

arabicText: أَمْوَٰتٌ غَيْرُ أَحْيَآءٍۢ ۖ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	are	dead,	not	alive;	and	 they	do	not	
know	when	will	the	people	be	raised.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Murde	haiñ	zinda	nahiñ	aur	unheñ	khabar	
nahiñ	log	kab	uthāye	jāyeñ	ge

arabicText: إِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌۭ وَٰحِدٌۭ ۚ فَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ قُلُوبُهُم مُّنكِرَةٌۭ وَهُم مُّسْتَكْبِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Your	God	is	One	God;	so	those	who	do	not	
believe	in	the	Hereafter	- their	hearts	deny	
and	they	are	proud.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumhārā	m’abood	ek	m’abood	hai	to	woh	
jo	 āakhirat par	Imān	 nahiñ	lāte	 un	 ke	 dil	
munkir	haiñ	aur	woh	maghroor

arabicText: لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُسْتَكْبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Certainly	Allah knows	what	they	hide	and	
what	they	disclose;	indeed	He	does	not	like	the	proud.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Fil	haqiqat	Allāh	jāntā	hai	jo	chupāte	aur jo	zahir	karte	haiñ	be-shak		woh	maghrooroñ	ko	pasand	
nahiñ	farmātā

arabicText: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُم مَّاذَآ أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُمْ ۙ قَالُوٓا۟ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	it	is	said	 to	 them,	“What	has	your	Lord	sent	down?”,	 they	say,	“The	 tales	of	 former	
people.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	un	se	kahā	jāye	tumhāre	Rab	ne	kyā	utārā	kaheñ	agloñ	ki	kahāniyāñ	haiñ

arabicText: لِيَحْمِلُوٓا۟ أَوْزَارَهُمْ كَامِلَةًۭ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ وَمِنْ أَوْزَارِ ٱلَّذِينَ يُضِلُّونَهُم بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۗ أَلَا سَآءَ مَا يَزِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
In	order	to	bear	their	full	burdens	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection,	and	some	burdens	of	those	whom	
they	mislead	with	their	ignorance;	pay	heed!	What	an	evil	burden	they	bear!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	Qiyāmat	ke	din	apne	bojh	poore	uthāyeñ	aur	kuchh bojh	un	ke	jinheñ	apni	jahālat	se	gumrāh	
karte	haiñ	Sun lo	kyā	hi	burā	bojh	uthāte	haiñ.

arabicText: قَدْ مَكَرَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَأَتَى ٱللَّهُ بُنْيَـٰنَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْقَوَاعِدِ فَخَرَّ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلسَّقْفُ مِن فَوْقِهِمْ وَأَتَىٰهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those	before	them	had	plotted,	so	Allah seized	the	foundations	of	their	building,	therefore	
the	roof	fell	down	upon	them	from	a	height,	and	the	punishment	came	upon	them	from	a	place	
they	did	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		un	se	agloñ	ne	fareb	kiyā	thā	to	Allāh	ne	un	ki	chunāi	ko	niw	(bunyād)	se	liyā	to	ūpar	se	
un	par	chat	gir	padi	aur	‘aƶāb	un	par	wahāñ	se	āayā	jahāñ	ki	unheñ	khabar	na	thi

arabicText: ثُمَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ يُخْزِيهِمْ وَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَآءِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تُشَـٰٓقُّونَ فِيهِمْ ۚ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ إِنَّ ٱلْخِزْىَ ٱلْيَوْمَ وَٱلسُّوٓءَ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	 on	 the	 Day	 of	 Resurrection	 He	 will	
disgrace	 them	 and	 proclaim,	 “Where	 are	
My	 partners,	 concerning	 whom	 you	
disputed?”;	 the	 people	 of	 knowledge	 will	
say,	 “All	 disgrace	 and	 evil	 is	 upon	 the	
disbelievers	this	day.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	Qiyāmat	ke	din	unheñ	ruswā	kare	ga	
aur	 farmāye	 gā	 kahāñ	 haiñ	 mere	 woh	
sharik	jin	meiñ	tum	jhagadte	they	ìlm	wāle	
kaheñ	ge	āaj	sāri	ruswāi	aur	burāi	kāfiroñ	
par	hai.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ تَتَوَفَّىٰهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ ظَالِمِىٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ ۖ فَأَلْقَوُا۟ ٱلسَّلَمَ مَا كُنَّا نَعْمَلُ مِن سُوٓءٍۭ ۚ بَلَىٰٓ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 whose	 souls	 the	 angels	 remove	
whilst	they	were	wronging	themselves;	so	
now	they	will	plead	“We	never	used	to	do	
any	wrong”;	"Yes	you	did,	why	not?	Indeed	
Allah well	knows	what	you	used	to	do."
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	ke	Firishte	un	ki	jān	nikālte	haiñ	is	hāl	
par	 ke	 woh	 apnā	 burā	 kar	 rahe	 they	 ab	
sulah	dāleñ	ge	ke	ham	to	kuchh		burāi	na	
karte	 they	hāñ	kyuñ	nahiñ	be-shak		Allāh	
khoob	 jāntā	 hai	 jo	 tumhāre	 kautak	
(kartoot)	they

arabicText: فَٱدْخُلُوٓا۟ أَبْوَٰبَ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ فَلَبِئْسَ مَثْوَى ٱلْمُتَكَبِّرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“So	now	enter	the	gates	of	hell,	remaining	
in	it	for	ever”;	so	what	an	evil	destination	
for	the	arrogant!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ab	 jahannam	 ke	 darwāzoñ	 meiñ	 jāo	 ke	
hameshā	 us	 meiñ	 raho	 to	 kyā	 hi	 burā	
thikāna	maghrooroñ	kā.

arabicText: ۞ وَقِيلَ لِلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوْا۟ مَاذَآ أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُمْ ۚ قَالُوا۟ خَيْرًۭا ۗ لِّلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةٌۭ ۚ وَلَدَارُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ خَيْرٌۭ ۚ وَلَنِعْمَ دَارُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 it	 was	 said	 to	 the	 pious,	 “What	 has	
your	 Lord	 sent	 down?”	 They	 said,	
“Goodness”;	for	those	who	did	good	in	this	
world	 is	 goodness,	 and	 the	 final	 home	 is	
the	 best;	 and	 indeed	 what	 an	 excellent	
final	home	for	the	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 dar	wāloñ	 se	 kahā	gayā	 tumhāre	 rab	
ne	 kyā	 utārā	 bole	 khoobi	 jinhoñ	 ne	 is	
dunyā	meiñ	bhalāi	ki	un	ke	liye	bhalāi	hai	
aur	be-shak		pichlā	ghar	sab	se	behtar	aur	
zaroor	kyā	hi	achchā	ghar	parhez-gāroñ	kā

arabicText: جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍۢ يَدْخُلُونَهَا تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ لَهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَآءُونَ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَجْزِى ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Everlasting	 Gardens	 of	 Eden	 which	 they	
will	enter,	beneath	which	rivers	flow	- in	it	
they	 will	 get	 whatever	 they	 wish;	 this	 is	
how	Allah rewards	the	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Basne ke	 bāgh	 jin	 meiñ	 jāyeñ	 ge	 un	 ke	
niche	nehreñ	rawāñ	unheñ	wahāñ	mile	gā	
jo	 chāhen	 Allāh	 esā	 hi	 sila	 detā	 hai	
parhezgāroñ	 ka	 Basne	 ke	 bāgh	 jin	 meiñ	
jāyeñge	un	ke	neeche	nahre	rawāñ	unheñ	
wahāñ	milega	jo	chāhe	Allah	aisa	hi	sila	deta	hai	parhezgāroñ	ko.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ تَتَوَفَّىٰهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ طَيِّبِينَ ۙ يَقُولُونَ سَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	whose	souls	the	angels	remove	in	a	
state	of	purity,	saying,	“Peace	be	upon	you	
- enter	 Paradise,	 the	 reward	 of	 your	
deeds.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jin	ki	jān	nikālte	haiñ	firishte	suthre	pan	meiñ	yeh	kahte		huye	ke	salāmati	ho	tum	par	jannat	
meiñ	jāo	badlā	apne	kiye	kā.

arabicText: هَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن تَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ أَوْ يَأْتِىَ أَمْرُ رَبِّكَ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ فَعَلَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ وَمَا ظَلَمَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	 what	 are	 they	 waiting	 for,	 except	 that	 the	 angels	 come	 upon	 them	 or	 that	 your	 Lord’s	
punishment	comes?	Those	before	them	did	exactly	this;	and	Allah did	not	oppress	them	at	all,	but	
it	is	they	who	used	to	wrong	themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kāhe	ke	intiżār	meiñ	haiñ	magar	iske	ke	firishte	in	par	āayeñ	yā	tumhāre	Rab	kā	‘aƶāb	āaye		in	se	
agloñ	ne	bhi	aisā	hi	kiyā	aur	Allāh	ne	un	par	kuchh		ƶulm	na	kiyā	hāñ	woh	khud	hi	apni	jānoñ	par	
ƶulm	karte	they

arabicText: فَأَصَابَهُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتُ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ وَحَاقَ بِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
englishTranslationText: So	the	evils	of	their	deeds	struck	them,	and	what	they	used	to	mock	at	surrounded	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	un	ki	buri		kamāiyāñ	un	par	padiñ	aur	unheñ	gher	liyā	us	ne	jis	par	hañste	they.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا۟ لَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مَا عَبَدْنَا مِن دُونِهِۦ مِن شَىْءٍۢ نَّحْنُ وَلَآ ءَابَآؤُنَا وَلَا حَرَّمْنَا مِن دُونِهِۦ مِن شَىْءٍۢ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ فَعَلَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ فَهَلْ عَلَى ٱلرُّسُلِ إِلَّا ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	polytheists	said,	“Had	Allah willed,	
we	would	 not	 have	worshipped	 anything	
besides	 Him	 - neither	 we	 nor	 our	
forefathers	 - and	 nor	 would	 we	 have	
forbidden	 anything,	 whilst	 being	
disassociated	 with	 Him”;	 those	 before	
them	 did	 exactly	 this;	 so	 what	 is	
(incumbent)	 upon	 the	 Noble	 Messengers,	
except	to	plainly	convey	(the	message)?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 mushrik	 bole	 Allāh	 chāhtā	 to	 us	 ke	
siwā	 kuchh	 	 na	 poojte	 na	 ham	 aur	 na	
hamāre	bāp	dādā	aur	na	us	se	judā	ho	kar	
ham	koi	chiz	harām	thehrāte	aisā	hi	in	se	
agloñ	 ne	 kiyā	 to	 Rasooloñ	 par	 kyā	 hai	
magar	sāf	pahuñchā	denā.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ بَعَثْنَا فِى كُلِّ أُمَّةٍۢ رَّسُولًا أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱجْتَنِبُوا۟ ٱلطَّـٰغُوتَ ۖ فَمِنْهُم مَّنْ هَدَى ٱللَّهُ وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ حَقَّتْ عَلَيْهِ ٱلضَّلَـٰلَةُ ۚ فَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 indeed	 We	 sent	 to	 every	 nation	 a	
Noble	 Messenger	 (proclaiming)	 that	
“Worship	Allah and	 beware	 of	 the	 devil”;	
therefore	Allah guided	some	of	them,	and	
error	 proved	 true	 upon	 some	 of	 them;	
therefore	 travel	in	 the	land	and	see	what	
sort	of	fate	befell	the	deniers!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak		har	Ummat	meiñ	se	ham	ne	
ek	 Rasool bhejā	 ke	 Allāh	 ko	 poojo	 aur	
shaiṭān		se	bacho	to	un	meiñ	kisi	ko	Allāh	
ne	rāh	dikhāyi	aur	kisi	par	gumrāhi	theek	
utri	 to	 zamin	 meiñ	 chal	 phir	 kar	 dekho	
kaisā	anjām	huā	jhutlāne	wāloñ	kā.

arabicText: إِن تَحْرِصْ عَلَىٰ هُدَىٰهُمْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى مَن يُضِلُّ ۖ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
If	you	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad - peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him)	desire	for	their	
guidance,	then	indeed	Allah does	not	guide	
one	 whom	 He	 misleads,	 and	 they	 do	 not	
have	any	aides
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	tum	un	ki	hidāyat	ki	hirs	karo	to	beshak		Allāh	Hidāyat	nahiñ	detā	jise	gumrāh	
kare	aur	un	kā	koi	madadgār	nahiñ

arabicText: وَأَقْسَمُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَـٰنِهِمْ ۙ لَا يَبْعَثُ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَمُوتُ ۚ بَلَىٰ وَعْدًا عَلَيْهِ حَقًّۭا وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	swore	by	Allah most	vehemently	
in	their	oaths	that,	“Allah will	not	raise	up	
the	 dead”;	 yes	 He	 will,	 why	 not?	 A	 true	
promise	 obligatory	 upon	 Him,	 but	 most	
men	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 unhoñ	 ne	 Allāh	 ki	 qasam	 khāyi	 apne	
half	meiñ	had	ki	koshish	se	ke	Allāh	murde	
na	uthāye	gā	hāñ	kyuñ	nahiñ	sachchā	w’ādā	us	ke	zimme	par	lekin	aksar	log	nahiñ	Jānte

arabicText: لِيُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يَخْتَلِفُونَ فِيهِ وَلِيَعْلَمَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ كَـٰذِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
In	order	that	He	may	make	clear	to	them	the	matter	in	which	they	differed,	and	the	disbelievers	
may	realise	that	they	were	liars.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Is	liye	ke	unheñ	sāf	batā	de	jis	bāt	meiñ	jhagadte	they	aur	is	liye	ke	kāfir	jān	leñ	ke	woh	jhoote	
they

arabicText: إِنَّمَا قَوْلُنَا لِشَىْءٍ إِذَآ أَرَدْنَـٰهُ أَن نَّقُولَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
englishTranslationText:
And	Our	command	for	anything	to	occur,	when	We	will	it,	is	that	We	only	say	to	it,	“Be”	- and	it	
thereupon	happens.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	chiz	ham	chāheñ	us	se	hamārā	farmāna	yahi	hotā	hai	ke	ham	kaheñ	ho	jā	woh	foran	ho	jāti	hai

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا۟ فِى ٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ لَنُبَوِّئَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةًۭ ۖ وَلَأَجْرُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	to	those	who	migrated	in	Allah's	cause	after	being	oppressed,	We	shall	indeed	give	them	a	
good	place	in	the	world,	and	indeed	the	reward	of	the	Hereafter	is	extremely	great;	if	only	the	
people	knew!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jinhoñ	ne	Allāh	ki	rāh	meiñ	apne	ghar	bār	chode	mazloom	ho	kar	zaroor	ham	unheñ	duniyā	
meiñ	achchi	jagah	deñ	ge	aur	be-shak		āakhirat		kā	sawāb	bahut	badā	hai	kisi	ṭarah	log	jānte

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا۟ وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
englishTranslationText: Those	who	patiently	endured	and	who	rely	only	upon	Allah
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	jinhoñ	ne	sabr	kiyā	aur	apne	Rab	hi	par	bharosā	karte	haiñ

arabicText: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ إِلَّا رِجَالًۭا نُّوحِىٓ إِلَيْهِمْ ۚ فَسْـَٔلُوٓا۟ أَهْلَ ٱلذِّكْرِ إِن كُنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 did	 not	 send	 before	 you	 except	
men,	 towards	 whom	 We	 sent	 divine
revelation	- so	O	people,	ask	 the	people	of	
knowledge	 if	 you	 do	 not	 know.	 (*All	
Prophets	were	men)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur Ham	ne	tum	se	pahle		na	bheje	magar	
mard	jin	ki	ṭaraf	ham	waḥi	karte	to	aey	logo!	
ìlm	wāloñ	se	poocho	agar	tumheñ	ìlm	nahiñ

arabicText: بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ وَٱلزُّبُرِ ۗ وَأَنزَلْنَآ إِلَيْكَ ٱلذِّكْرَ لِتُبَيِّنَ لِلنَّاسِ مَا نُزِّلَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Along	 with	 clear	 proofs	 and	 writings;	 and	
We	 have	 sent	 down	 this	 Remembrance	
towards	you	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad -
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	so	that	you	
may	 explain	 to	 mankind	 what	 has	 been	
revealed	towards	them,	and	that	they	may	
ponder.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Raushan	dalileñ	aur	kitābeñ		lekar	aur	aey	
mahboob!	ham	ne	tumhāri	ṭaraf	yeh	yādgār	
utāri	ke	tum	logoñ	se	bayān	kar	do	jo	un	ki	
ṭaraf	utrā	aur	kahiñ	woh	dhiyān	kareñ

arabicText: أَفَأَمِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَكَرُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ أَن يَخْسِفَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ أَوْ يَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	do	they	who	conspire	evils,	not	fear	that	
Allah may	 bury	 them	in	 the	 earth,	 or	 that	
the	punishment	may	come	 to	 them	 from	a	
place	they	do	not	know?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 kyā	 jo	 log	 bure	 makr	 karte	 haiñ	 us	 se	
nahiñ	 darte	 ke	 Allāh	 unheñ	 zamin	 meiñ	
dhañsā	 de	 yā	 unheñ	 wahañ	 se ‘aƶāb	 āaye		
jahāñ	se	unheñ	khabar	na	ho

arabicText: أَوْ يَأْخُذَهُمْ فِى تَقَلُّبِهِمْ فَمَا هُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	that	He	may	seize	them	while	they	move	
here	and	there,	for	they	cannot	escape?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yā	 unheñ	 chalte	 phirte	 pakad	 le	 ke	 woh	
thakā	nahiñ	sakte

arabicText: أَوْ يَأْخُذَهُمْ عَلَىٰ تَخَوُّفٍۢ فَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌۭ رَّحِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
Or	that	He	may	seize	them	whilst	constantly	
ruining	 them?	For	indeed	your	Lord	is	Most	
Compassionate,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yā	unheñ	nuqsān	dete	dete	giriftār	kar	le	ke	
be-shak tumhārā	 Rab	 nihāyat	 maherbān		
rahem		wālā	hai

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ مِن شَىْءٍۢ يَتَفَيَّؤُا۟ ظِلَـٰلُهُۥ عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَٱلشَّمَآئِلِ سُجَّدًۭا لِّلَّهِ وَهُمْ دَٰخِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 have	 they	 not	 observed	 that	 the	
shadows	 of	 the	 things	 Allah has	 created	
incline	 to	 the	 right	 and	 to	 the	 left,	 in	
prostration	 to	 Allah,	 and	 that	 they	 are	
servile?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	unhoñ	ne	na	dekhā	ke	jo	chiz	Allāh	
ne	 banāyi	 hai	 us	 ki	 parchāiyāñ	 dāhine	aur	
bāyeñ	 jhukti	 haiñ	 Allāh	 ko	 sajdā	 karti	 aur	
woh	us	ke	huzoor	żalil	haiñ

arabicText: وَلِلَّهِ يَسْجُدُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِن دَآبَّةٍۢ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَهُمْ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	to	Allah only	prostrates	whatsoever	is	
in	 the	 heavens	 and	 whatsoever	 moves	 in	
the	earth,	and	the	angels	- and	they	are	not	
proud.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Allāh ko	 Sajdā karte	 haiñ	 jo	 kuchh		
āasmānoñ		aur	zamin	meiñ	chalne	wālā	hai	
aur	firishte	aur	woh	ghuroor	nahiñ	karte.

arabicText: وَلِلَّهِ يَسْجُدُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِن دَآبَّةٍۢ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَهُمْ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	to	Allah only	prostrates	whatsoever	is	
in	 the	 heavens	 and	 whatsoever	 moves	 in	
the	earth,	and	the	angels	- and	they	are	not	
proud.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Allāh ko	 Sajdā karte	 haiñ	 jo	 kuchh		
āasmānoñ		aur	zamin	meiñ	chalne	wālā	hai	
aur	firishte	aur	woh	ghuroor	nahiñ	karte.

arabicText: يَخَافُونَ رَبَّهُم مِّن فَوْقِهِمْ وَيَفْعَلُونَ مَا يُؤْمَرُونَ ۩
englishTranslationText:
They	bear	upon	themselves	the	fear	of	their	
Lord,	and	do	only	what	they	are	commanded.	(Command of Prostration # 3)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apne	ūpar	apne	Rab	kā	khauf	karte	haiñ	aur	
wohi		karte	haiñ	jo	unheñ	hukm	ho
(Sajde	ka	hukm	#3)

arabicText: ۞ وَقَالَ ٱللَّهُ لَا تَتَّخِذُوٓا۟ إِلَـٰهَيْنِ ٱثْنَيْنِ ۖ إِنَّمَا هُوَ إِلَـٰهٌۭ وَٰحِدٌۭ ۖ فَإِيَّـٰىَ فَٱرْهَبُونِ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah has	proclaimed,	“Do	not	ascribe	two	Gods;	indeed	He	is	the	only	One	God;	therefore	
fear	Me	alone.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Allāh	ne	farmāyā	do	khudā	na	thahrāo	woh	to	ek	hi	m’abood	hai	to	mujhi	se	daro

arabicText: وَلَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَهُ ٱلدِّينُ وَاصِبًا ۚ أَفَغَيْرَ ٱللَّهِ تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	to	Him	only	belongs	all	whatever	is	in	the	heavens	and	in	the	earth,	and	obeying	Him	only	is	
obligatory;	so	will	you	fear	anyone	other	than	Allah?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	usi	kā	hai	jo	kuchh		āasmānoñ aur	zamin	meiñ	hai	aur	usi	ki	farmāñ	bardāri	lāzim	hai	to	kyā	
Allāh	ke	siwā	kisi	doosre	se	daro	ge

arabicText: وَمَا بِكُم مِّن نِّعْمَةٍۢ فَمِنَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِذَا مَسَّكُمُ ٱلضُّرُّ فَإِلَيْهِ تَجْـَٔرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	whatever	blessings	you	have,	are	all	 from	Allah - then	whenever	misfortune	reaches	you,	
towards	Him	only	do	you	seek	refuge.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāre	pās	jo	ne’mat	hai	sab	Allāh	ki	ṭaraf	se	hai	phir	jab	tumheñ	taklif	pahuñchti	hai	to	usi	
ki	ṭaraf	panāh	le	jāte	ho

arabicText: ثُمَّ إِذَا كَشَفَ ٱلضُّرَّ عَنكُمْ إِذَا فَرِيقٌۭ مِّنكُم بِرَبِّهِمْ يُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	then,	when	He	averts	the	misfortune	from	you,	a	group	among	you	starts	ascribing	partners	
to	their	Lord!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	woh	tum	se	burāyi	tāl	detā	hai	to	tum	meiñ	ek	giroh	apne	Rab	kā	shareek	thehrāne	lagtā	
hai

arabicText: لِيَكْفُرُوا۟ بِمَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ ۚ فَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ ۖ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
In	order	to	deny	the	favours	We	have	given	
them;	 so	 enjoy	 a	 little;	 for	 you	 will	 soon	
come	to	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	Hamāri	di	ne’matoñ		ki	nā	shukri	kareñ	
to	kuchh		barat	lo	ke	‘an-qarib	jān	jāo	ge

arabicText: وَيَجْعَلُونَ لِمَا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ نَصِيبًۭا مِّمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ ۗ تَٱللَّهِ لَتُسْـَٔلُنَّ عَمَّا كُنتُمْ تَفْتَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	for	things	unknown,	they	assign	a	portion	
of	 the	 sustenance	 We	 have	 given	 them;	 by	
Allah - you	 will	 certainly	 be	 questioned	
regarding	all	that	you	used	to	fabricate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	anjāni	chizoñ	ke	liye	hamāri	di	hui	rozi	
meiñ	se	hissā	muqarrar	karte	haiñ	khudā	ki	
qasam	 tum	 se	 zaroor	 sawāl	 honā	 hai	 jo	
kuchh		jhoot	bāndhte	they

arabicText: وَيَجْعَلُونَ لِلَّهِ ٱلْبَنَـٰتِ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ ۙ وَلَهُم مَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	assign	daughters	to	Allah - Purity	
is	to	Him!	- and	assign	for	themselves	what	
they	wish.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ke	liye	betiyān	thehrāte	haiñ	pāki	
hai	us	ko	aur	apne	liye	jo	apnā	jee	chāhtā	hai

arabicText: وَإِذَا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُم بِٱلْأُنثَىٰ ظَلَّ وَجْهُهُۥ مُسْوَدًّۭا وَهُوَ كَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	one	among	of	them	receives	the	
glad	 tidings	 of	 a	 daughter,	 his	 face	 turns	
black	for	the	day,	and	he	remains	seething.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 un	 meiñ	 kisi	 ko	 beti	 hone	 ki	
khushkhabri	 di	 jāti	 hai	 to	 din	 bhar	 us	 kā	
muñh	 kālā	 rahtā hai	 aur	 woh	 gussa	 khātā	
hai

arabicText: يَتَوَٰرَىٰ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ مِن سُوٓءِ مَا بُشِّرَ بِهِۦٓ ۚ أَيُمْسِكُهُۥ عَلَىٰ هُونٍ أَمْ يَدُسُّهُۥ فِى ٱلتُّرَابِ ۗ أَلَا سَآءَ مَا يَحْكُمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Hiding	from	the	people	because	of	the	evil	of	
the	tidings;	“Will	he	keep	her	with	disgrace,	or	
bury	her	beneath	the	earth?”;	pay	heed!	Very	
evil	is	the	judgement	they	impose!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Logoñ	 se	 chuptā	 phirtā	 hai	 is	 bashārat	 ki	
burāi	ke	sabab	kyā	isey		zillat	ke	sāth	rakhe	
gā	yā	isey		mitti	meiñ	dabā	degā	arey	bahut	
hi	burā	hukm	lagāte	haiñ

arabicText: لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ مَثَلُ ٱلسَّوْءِ ۖ وَلِلَّهِ ٱلْمَثَلُ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	do	not	believe	in	 the	Hereafter,	
for	 them	 only	 is	 the	 evil	 state;	 and	 the	
Majesty	of	Allah is	Supreme;	and	He	only	is	
the	Most	Honourable,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	 āakhirat par	 Imān	 nahiñ	 lāte	 unhiñ	 kā	
burā	hāl	hai	aur	Allāh	ki	Shān	sab	se	baland	
aur	wohi		Ízzat-o-Hikmat	wālā	hai

arabicText: وَلَوْ يُؤَاخِذُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلنَّاسَ بِظُلْمِهِم مَّا تَرَكَ عَلَيْهَا مِن دَآبَّةٍۢ وَلَـٰكِن يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّۭى ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهُمْ لَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ سَاعَةًۭ ۖ وَلَا يَسْتَقْدِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Were	 Allah to	 seize	 people	 on	 account	 of	
their	 injustices,	 He	 would	 not	 have	 left	
anyone	walking	on	 the	earth,	but	He	gives	
them	 respite	 up	 to	 an	 appointed	 promise;	
then	when	their	promise	comes	they	cannot	
go	back	one	moment	nor	come	forward.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	Allāh	logoñ	ko	un	ke	ƶulm	par	girift	
kartā	 to	 zamin	 par	 koi	 chalne	 wālā	 nahiñ	
chodtā	lekin	 unheñ	ek	 thehrāye	w’ade	 tak	
mohlat	detā	hai	phir	jab	un	kā	w’adā	āaye	gā	
na	ek	ghadi	peechhe		hateñ	na	āage		badheñ.

arabicText: وَيَجْعَلُونَ لِلَّهِ مَا يَكْرَهُونَ وَتَصِفُ أَلْسِنَتُهُمُ ٱلْكَذِبَ أَنَّ لَهُمُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۖ لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّ لَهُمُ ٱلنَّارَ وَأَنَّهُم مُّفْرَطُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 assign	 to	 Allah that	 which	 is	
abhorred	by	themselves,	and	their	tongues	
speak	the	lies	that	goodness	is	for	them;	so	it	occurred	that	for	them	is	the	fire,	and	they	have	
crossed	the	limits.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ke	liye	woh	thehrāte	haiñ	jo	apne	
liye	nā	gawār	hai	aur	un	ki	zabāneñ	jhootoñ	kahti	haiñ	ke	un	ke	liye	bhalāi	hai	to	āap	hi	huā	ke	
unke	liye	āag	hai	aur	woh	had	se	guzāre	huye	haiñ

arabicText: تَٱللَّهِ لَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ أُمَمٍۢ مِّن قَبْلِكَ فَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَهُوَ وَلِيُّهُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
By	Allah,	We	indeed	sent	Noble	Messengers	to	several	nations	before	you,	but	Satan	made	their	
misdeeds	 appear	 good	 to	 them	 - so	 he	 only	 is	 their	 companion	 this	 day,	 and	 for	 them	 is	 a	
punishment,	most	painful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Khudā	ki	qasam	ham	ne	tum	se	pahle		kitni	ummatoñ	ki	ṭaraf	Rasool bheje	to	shaiṭān		ne	un	ke	
kautak	(bure	a’amāl)	un	ki	āañkhoñ	meiñ	bhale	kar	dikhāye	to	āaj	wohi		un	kā	rafiq	hai	aur	un	ke	
liye	dardnāk	‘aƶāb	hai

arabicText: وَمَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ إِلَّا لِتُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى ٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ فِيهِ ۙ وَهُدًۭى وَرَحْمَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	did	not	send	down	this	Book	towards	you	except for	you	to	clearly	explain	to	them	the	
matters	in	which	they	may	differ,	and	a	guidance	and	a	mercy	for	the	believers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	tum	par	yeh	kitāb	na	utāri	magar	is	liye	ke	tum	logoñ	par	raushan	kar	do	jis	bāt	meiñ	
ikhtilāf		kareñ	aur	hidāyat	aur	rahmat		Imān	wāloñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَحْيَا بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَآ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَسْمَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah sent	 down	water	 from	 the	 sky	
and	 with	 it	 revived	 the	 earth	 after	 its	
death;	 indeed	 in	 this	 is	 a	 sign	 for	 people	
who	keep	ears	*.	(*	That	listen	to	the	truth.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ne	āasmān		se	pāni	utārā	to	us	se	
zamin	 ko	 zinda	 kar	 diyā	 us	 ke	 mare	
peechhe		be-shak		is	meiñ	nishāni	hai	un	ko	
jo	kān	rakhte	haiñ

arabicText: وَإِنَّ لَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ لَعِبْرَةًۭ ۖ نُّسْقِيكُم مِّمَّا فِى بُطُونِهِۦ مِنۢ بَيْنِ فَرْثٍۢ وَدَمٍۢ لَّبَنًا خَالِصًۭا سَآئِغًۭا لِّلشَّـٰرِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	in	cattle	is	a	lesson	for	you;	We	
provide	 you	 drink	 from	 what	 is	 in	 their	
bellies	 - pure	 milk	 from	 between	 the	
excretion	and	the	blood,	palatable	 for	the	
drinkers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak		tumhāre	liye	chaupāyoñ	meiñ	
nigāh	hāsil	hone	ki	jagah	hai	ham	tumheñ	
pilāte	 haiñ	 us	 chiz	 meiñ	 se	 jo	 un	 ke	 pet	
meiñ	hai	gobar	aur	khoon	ke	beech	meiñ	
se	 khālis	 doodh	 gale	 se	 sahal	 utartā	 pine	
wāloñ	ke	liye

arabicText: وَمِن ثَمَرَٰتِ ٱلنَّخِيلِ وَٱلْأَعْنَـٰبِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِنْهُ سَكَرًۭا وَرِزْقًا حَسَنًا ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	from	the	fruits	of	date	and	grapes,	for	
you	 make	 juices	 and	 good	 nourishment	
from	 them;	 indeed	 in	 this	 is	 a	 sign	 for	
people	of	intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	khajoor	aur	angoor	ke	phaloñ	meiñ	se	
ke	is	se	nabeeż	banāte	ho	aur	achchā	rizq	
be-shak		is	meiñ	nishāni	hai	‘aql	wāloñ	ko

arabicText: وَأَوْحَىٰ رَبُّكَ إِلَى ٱلنَّحْلِ أَنِ ٱتَّخِذِى مِنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًۭا وَمِنَ ٱلشَّجَرِ وَمِمَّا يَعْرِشُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	your	Lord	inspired	the	bee	that,	“Build	
homes	 in	 hills,	 and	 in	 trees,	 and	 in	
rooftops.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāre	Rab	ne	shahed	ki	makkhi	ko	
ilhām	kiyā	ke	pahādoñ	meiñ	ghar	banā	aur	
darakhtoñ	meiñ	aur	chatoñ	meiñ

arabicText: ثُمَّ كُلِى مِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ فَٱسْلُكِى سُبُلَ رَبِّكِ ذُلُلًۭا ۚ يَخْرُجُ مِنۢ بُطُونِهَا شَرَابٌۭ مُّخْتَلِفٌ أَلْوَٰنُهُۥ فِيهِ شِفَآءٌۭ لِّلنَّاسِ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Then	eat	from	all	kinds	of	fruits,	and	tread	
the	ways	of	your	Lord	which	are	soft	and	
easy	 for	 you”;	 from	 their	 bellies	 comes	 a	
drink	of	various	colours,	in	which is	health	
for	 mankind;	 indeed	 in	 this	 is	 a	 sign	 for	
people	who	ponder.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	har	qism	ke	phal	meiñ	se	khā	aur	apne	
Rab	ki	rāheñ	chal	ke	tere	liye	narm-o-āsān	
haiñ	us	ke	pet	se	ek	pine	ki	chiz	rang	birang
nikalti	hai	jis	meiñ	logoñ	ki	tandurusti	hai	
be-shak is	meiñ	nishāni	hai	dhiyān	karne	
wāloñ	ko

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمْ ثُمَّ يَتَوَفَّىٰكُمْ ۚ وَمِنكُم مَّن يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰٓ أَرْذَلِ ٱلْعُمُرِ لِكَىْ لَا يَعْلَمَ بَعْدَ عِلْمٍۢ شَيْـًٔا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۭ قَدِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 Allah created	 you,	 and	 will	 then	
remove	your	souls;	and	among	you	is	one	
who	is	sent	back	to	the	most	lowly	age,	so	
knowing	 nothing	 after	 having	 had	
knowledge;	 indeed	 Allah knows	
everything,	is	Able	to	do	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Allāh	 ne	 tumheñ	 paidā	 kiyā	 phir	
tumhāri	jān	qabz	kare	ga	aur	tum	meiñ	koi	
sab	se	nāqis	umr	ki	ṭaraf	pherā	jātā	hai	ke	
janne	ke	b’ad	kuchh		na	jāne	be-shak	 Allāh	sab	kuchh jāntā	sab	kuchh kar	saktā	hai.

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ فَضَّلَ بَعْضَكُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍۢ فِى ٱلرِّزْقِ ۚ فَمَا ٱلَّذِينَ فُضِّلُوا۟ بِرَآدِّى رِزْقِهِمْ عَلَىٰ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُهُمْ فَهُمْ فِيهِ سَوَآءٌ ۚ أَفَبِنِعْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ يَجْحَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah has	made	some	among	you	superior	above	others	in	livelihood;	so	those	to	whom	the	
superiority	is	given,	will	not	return	their	livelihood	to	their	slaves,	so	they	may	all	become	equal	
in	this	respect;	so	do	they	deny	the	favours	of	Allah?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ne	tum	meiñ	ek	ko	doosre	par	rizq	meiñ	badāi	di	to	jinheñ	badāi	di	hai	woh	apnā	rizq	
apne	bāñdi	ghulāmoñ	ko	na	pher	deñ	ge	ke	woh	sab	us	meiñ	barābar	ho	jāyeñ	to	kyā	Allāh	ki	
ne’mat	se	mukarte	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنْ أَنفُسِكُمْ أَزْوَٰجًۭا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم بَنِينَ وَحَفَدَةًۭ وَرَزَقَكُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ ۚ أَفَبِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ يُؤْمِنُونَ وَبِنِعْمَتِ ٱللَّهِ هُمْ يَكْفُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah has	created	for	you	wives	of	your	own	breed,	and	has	given	you	from	your	wives,	sons	
and	grandsons,	and	 has	 provided	 sustenance	 for	 you	 from	good	 things;	 so	 do	 they	 believe	in	
falsehood	and	deny	the	favours	of	Allah?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ne	tumhāre	liye	tumhāri	jins	se	‘aurateñ	banāiñ	aur	tumhāre	liye	tumhāri	‘auratoñ	se	
bete	aur	pote	nawāse	paidā	kiye	aur	tumheñ	suthri	chizoñ	se	rozi	di	to	kyā	jhooti	bāt	par	yaqin	
lāte	haiñ	aur	Allāh	ke	fazl	se	munkir	hote	haiñ.

arabicText: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَمْلِكُ لَهُمْ رِزْقًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ شَيْـًۭٔا وَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	worship	such	besides	Allah,	who	
do	 not	 have	 power	 to	 provide	 them	 any	
sustenance	from	the	heavens	or	the	earth,	
nor	can	they	do	anything.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Allāh	 ke	 siwā	 aioñ	 ko	 poojte	 haiñ	 jo	
unheñ	 āasmān	 	 aur	 zamin	 se	 kuchh	 	 bhi	
rozi	 dene	 kā	 ikhtiyār	 nahiñ	 rakhte	 na	
kuchh		kar	sakte	haiñ	.

arabicText: فَلَا تَضْرِبُوا۟ لِلَّهِ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
romanUrduTranslationText: To	 Allāh	 ke	 liye	 mānind	 na	 thehrāo	 beshak		Allāh	jāntā	hai	aur	tum	nahiñ	jānte.

arabicText: ۞ ضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًا عَبْدًۭا مَّمْلُوكًۭا لَّا يَقْدِرُ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍۢ وَمَن رَّزَقْنَـٰهُ مِنَّا رِزْقًا حَسَنًۭا فَهُوَ يُنفِقُ مِنْهُ سِرًّۭا وَجَهْرًا ۖ هَلْ يَسْتَوُۥنَ ۚ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Allah has	illustrated	an	example	- there	is	
a	 slave,	 himself	 the	 property	 of	 another,	
not	 owning	 anything	 - and	 another	 one	
upon	 whom	 We	 have	 bestowed	 a	 good	
livelihood	 from	 Us,	 he	 therefore	 spends	
from	it,	secretly	and	publicly;	will	they	be	
equal?	All	praise	is	to	Allah;	in	fact,	most	of	
them	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	 ne	 ek	 kahāwat	 bayān	 farmāyi	 ek	
banda	 hai	 doosre	 ki	 milk	 āap kuchh		
maqdoor	(ṭāqat)	nahiñ	rakhtā	aur	ek	woh	
jise	 ham	 ne	 apni	ṭaraf	 se	 achchi	 rozi	 ‘aṭā	
farmāi	to	woh	us	meiñ	se	kharch	kartā	hai	
chupe	aur	zahir	kyā	woh	barābar	ho	jāyeñ	
ge?	Sab	khoobiyāñ	Allāh	ko	haiñ	balke	un	
meiñ	aksar	ko	khabar	nahiñ

arabicText: وَضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًۭا رَّجُلَيْنِ أَحَدُهُمَآ أَبْكَمُ لَا يَقْدِرُ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍۢ وَهُوَ كَلٌّ عَلَىٰ مَوْلَىٰهُ أَيْنَمَا يُوَجِّههُّ لَا يَأْتِ بِخَيْرٍ ۖ هَلْ يَسْتَوِى هُوَ وَمَن يَأْمُرُ بِٱلْعَدْلِ ۙ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍۢ مُّسْتَقِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah has	illustrated	an	example	- two	
men	 - one	 of	 them	 dumb,	 unable	 to	 do	
anything,	and	he	is	a	burden	on	his	master	
- wherever	his	master	sends	him,	he	brings	
back	no	good;	will	he	be	equal	to	one	who	
gives	the	command	of	justice	and	is	on	the	
Straight	Path?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Allāh	 ne	 kahāwat	 bayān	 farmāyi	 do	
mard	ek	gooñgā	jo	kuchh		kām	nahiñ	kar	
saktā	aur	woh	apne	āqā	par	bojh	hai	jidhar	
bheje	kuchh		bhalāyi	na	lāye	kyā	barābar	ho	jāye	gā	yeh	aur	woh	jo	insāf	kā	hukm	kartā	hai	aur	
woh	sidhi	rāh	par	hai?

arabicText: وَلِلَّهِ غَيْبُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَآ أَمْرُ ٱلسَّاعَةِ إِلَّا كَلَمْحِ ٱلْبَصَرِ أَوْ هُوَ أَقْرَبُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	for	Allah only	are	the	hidden	things	of	
the	heavens	and	the	earth,	and	the	matter	
of	Resurrection	is	not	but	like	the	batting	
of	an	eyelid	- in	fact	closer	than	this;	indeed	
Allah is	Able	to	do	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	hi	ke	liye	haiñ	āasmānoñ aur	zamin	ki	chupi	cheezeñ	aur	Qiyāmat	kā	mu’āmla	nahiñ	
magar	jaise	ek	palak	kā	mārnā	balke	is	se	bhi	qarib	be-shak		Allāh	sab	kuchh		kar	saktā	hai.

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ أَخْرَجَكُم مِّنۢ بُطُونِ أُمَّهَـٰتِكُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ شَيْـًۭٔا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَـٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَ ۙ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah brought	you	forth	from	your	mothers’	wombs,	whilst	you	did	not	know	anything	*	-
and	gave	you	ears	and	eyes	and	hearts,	for	you	to	be	grateful.	(*	Prophet	Muhammad and	Prophet	
Jesus,	among	others,	are	exceptions	to	this	rule	- peace	and	blessings	be	upon	them.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ne	tumheñ	tumhāri	māoñ	ke	pet	se	paidā	kiyā	ke	kuchh		na	jānte	they	aur	tumheñ	kān	
aur	āñkh	aur	dil	diye	ke	tum	ehsān	māno

arabicText: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلطَّيْرِ مُسَخَّرَٰتٍۢ فِى جَوِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Have	they	not	seen	the	birds,	subservient	in	the	open	skies?	No	one	holds	them	up	except	Allah;	
indeed	in	this	are	signs	for	the	people	who	believe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	unhoñ	ne	parinde	na	dekhe	hukm	ke	bāñdhe	āasmān ki	fazā	meiñ	unheñ	koi	nahiñ	roktā	siwā	
khudā	ke	be-shak		is	meiñ	nishaniyāñ	haiñ	imān	wāloñ	ko

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنۢ بُيُوتِكُمْ سَكَنًۭا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّن جُلُودِ ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ بُيُوتًۭا تَسْتَخِفُّونَهَا يَوْمَ ظَعْنِكُمْ وَيَوْمَ إِقَامَتِكُمْ ۙ وَمِنْ أَصْوَافِهَا وَأَوْبَارِهَا وَأَشْعَارِهَآ أَثَـٰثًۭا وَمَتَـٰعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah has	given	you	houses	for	staying,	
and	made	some	houses	 from	 the	hides	of	
animals,	 which	 are	 easy	 for	 you	 on	 your	
day	of	travel	and	on	the	day	of	stopover	-
and	 from	 their	 wool,	 and	 fur,	 and	 hair,	
some	 household	 items	 and	 utilities	 for	 a	
while.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ne	 tumheiñ	ghar	diye	basne	 ko	
aur	 tumhāre	 liye	 chopāyoñ	 ki	 khāloñ	 se	
kuchh		ghar	banāye	jo	tumheñ	halke	padte	
haiñ	 tumhāre	 safar	 ke din	 aur	 manziloñ	
par	thaherne	ke	din	aur	un	ki	oon	aur	babri	
(ooñt	 ke	 bāl)	 aur	 bāloñ	 se	 kuchh	 girasti	
(gharelu	zaruriyāt)	kā	sāmān	aur	baratne	
ki	chizeñ	ek	waqt	tak.

arabicText: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّمَّا خَلَقَ ظِلَـٰلًۭا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ أَكْنَـٰنًۭا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمْ سَرَٰبِيلَ تَقِيكُمُ ٱلْحَرَّ وَسَرَٰبِيلَ تَقِيكُم بَأْسَكُمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُتِمُّ نِعْمَتَهُۥ عَلَيْكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُسْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah has	provided	you	shade	with	the	
things	He	has	created,	and	created	for	you	
refuge	 in	 the	 hills,	 and	 created	 some	
clothing	 for	 you	 to	 protect	 you	 from	 the	
heat,	 and	 some	 clothing	 to	 protect	 you	
during	 conflict;	 this	is	 how	He	 completes	
His	favour	upon	you,	so	that	you	may	obey.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Allāh	 ne	 tumheñ	 apni	 banāyi	 hui	
chizoñ	 se	 sāye	 diye	 aur	 tumhāre	 liye	
pahādoñ	meiñ	chupne	ki	jagah	banāyi	aur	
tumhāre	 liye	 kuchh	 	 pahnāwe	 banāye	 ke	
tumheñ	 garmi	 se	 bachāyeñ	 aur	 kuchh		
pehnāwe	 ke	 ladāi	 meiñ	 tumhāri	 hifāzat	
kareñ	 yooñ	 hi	apni	 ne’mat	 tum	 par	 poori	
kartā	hai	ke	tum	farmān	māno

arabicText: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
englishTranslationText:
Then	 if	 they	 turn	 away,	 O	 dear	 Prophet,	
(Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	 upon	 you	 is	 nothing	 but	 to	 clearly	
convey	(the	message).
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	agar	woh	muñh	phereñ	to	aey	Mehboob!	Tum	par	nahiñ	magar	sāf	pahuñchā	denā

arabicText: يَعْرِفُونَ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ ثُمَّ يُنكِرُونَهَا وَأَكْثَرُهُمُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 recognise	 the	 favour	 *	 of	Allah and	
then	 deny	 it,	 and	 most	 of	 them	 are	
disbelievers.	 (* Prophet Muhammad
(peace and blessings be upon him) and all 
the favours of Allah)
romanUrduTranslationText: Allāh	ki	ne’mat		pahchānte	haiñ	phir	us	se	munkir	hote	haiñ	aur	un	meiñ	aksar	kāfir	haiñ

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ نَبْعَثُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍۢ شَهِيدًۭا ثُمَّ لَا يُؤْذَنُ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَلَا هُمْ يُسْتَعْتَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 day	 when	 We	 will	 raise	 up	 a	
witness	 from	every	 nation	- then	 there	will	 be	 no	leave	 for	 the	 disbelievers,	 nor	will	 they	 be	
appeased.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	ham	uthāyeñ	ge	har	ummat	meiñ	se	ek	gawāh	phir	kāfiroñ	ko	na	ijāzat	ho	na	woh	
manāye	jāyeñ

arabicText: وَإِذَا رَءَا ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ فَلَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	the	unjust	will	see	the	punishment,	from	that	time	on	it	will	not	be	lightened	for	them,	
nor	will	they	get	respite.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ƶulm	karne	wāle	jab	‘aƶāb	dekheñ	ge	usi	waqt	se	na	woh	un	par	se	halkā	ho	na	unheñ	mohlat	
mile.

arabicText: وَإِذَا رَءَا ٱلَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا۟ شُرَكَآءَهُمْ قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ شُرَكَآؤُنَا ٱلَّذِينَ كُنَّا نَدْعُوا۟ مِن دُونِكَ ۖ فَأَلْقَوْا۟ إِلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقَوْلَ إِنَّكُمْ لَكَـٰذِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	the	polytheists	will	see	their	ascribed	partners,	they	will	say,	“Our	Lord!	These	are	our	
partners	whom	we	used	to	worship	besides	You”;	so	they	will	strike	back	at	them	with	the	saying,	
“You	are	indeed	liars!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	shirk	karne	wāle	jab	apne	shārikoñ	ko	dekheñ	ge	kaheñ	ge	aey	hamāre	Rab!	yeh	haiñ	hamāre	
sharik	ke	ham	tere	siwā	poojte	they	to	woh	un	par	bāt	pheñkeñ	ge	ke	tum	be-shak		jhoote	ho

arabicText: وَأَلْقَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلسَّلَمَ ۖ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	on	that	day	they	will	fall	humbly	before	Allah,	and	they	will	lose	all	that	they	used	to	fabricate.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us din	Allāh	ki	ṭaraf	‘aājizi	se	gireñ	ge	aur	un	se	gum	ho	jāyeñ	gi	jo	banāwateñ	karte	they.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَصَدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ زِدْنَـٰهُمْ عَذَابًۭا فَوْقَ ٱلْعَذَابِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يُفْسِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 who	 disbelieved	 and	 prevented	
from	 the	 way	 of	 Allah - We	 added	
punishment	 upon	 the	 punishment	 - the	
recompense	of	their	mischief.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jinhoñ	ne	kufr	kiyā	aur	Allāh	ki	rāh	se	rokā	
ham	ne	‘aƶāb	par	‘aƶāb	badhāyā	badlā	un	
ke	fasād	kā.

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ نَبْعَثُ فِى كُلِّ أُمَّةٍۢ شَهِيدًا عَلَيْهِم مِّنْ أَنفُسِهِمْ ۖ وَجِئْنَا بِكَ شَهِيدًا عَلَىٰ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ۚ وَنَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ تِبْيَـٰنًۭا لِّكُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ وَهُدًۭى وَرَحْمَةًۭ وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	day	when	We	will	raise	from	every	
group,	 a	 witness	 from	 among	 them,	 in	
order	to	testify	against	them	and	will	bring	
you	 O	 dear	 Prophet	(Muhammad - peace	
and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	 as	 a	 witness	
upon	them	all;	and	We	have	sent	down	this	
Qur’an	 upon	 you	 which	 is	 a	 clear	
explanation	 of	 all	 things,	 and	 a	 guidance	
and	 a	 mercy	 and	 glad	 tidings	 to	 the	
Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	ham	har	giroh	meiñ	ek	gawāh	
unhiñ	mein	se	uthāyeñ	ge	ke	un	par	gawāhi	
deñ	aur	aey	Mehboob!	Tumheñ	un	sab	par	
shāhid	banā	kar	layeñ	ge	aur	ham	ne	tum	
par	 yeh	 Qur'ān	 utārā	 ke	 har	 chiz	 kā	
raushan	bayān	hai	aur	Hidāyat	aur	Rahmat		
aur	bashārat	Musalmānoñ	ko

arabicText: ۞ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَأْمُرُ بِٱلْعَدْلِ وَٱلْإِحْسَـٰنِ وَإِيتَآئِ ذِى ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ وَيَنْهَىٰ عَنِ ٱلْفَحْشَآءِ وَٱلْمُنكَرِ وَٱلْبَغْىِ ۚ يَعِظُكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 Allah decrees	 the	 commands	 of	
justice	 and	 kindness,	 and	 of	 giving	 to	
relatives,	 and	 forbids	 from	 the	 shameful	
and	evil	and	 rebellion;	He	advises	 you	so	
that	you	may	pay	heed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		Allāh	hukm	farmātā	hai	insāf	aur	
neki	aur	rishte	dāroñ	ke	dene	kā	aur	man’a	
farmātā	 hai	 be	 hayāi	 aur	 buri	 bāt	 aur	
sarkashi	se	tumheñ	nasihat	farmātā	hai	ke	
tum	dhiyān	karo

arabicText: وَأَوْفُوا۟ بِعَهْدِ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا عَـٰهَدتُّمْ وَلَا تَنقُضُوا۟ ٱلْأَيْمَـٰنَ بَعْدَ تَوْكِيدِهَا وَقَدْ جَعَلْتُمُ ٱللَّهَ عَلَيْكُمْ كَفِيلًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	fulfil	the	covenant	of	Allah when	you	
have	made	the	promise,	and	do	not	break	
your	 oaths	 after	 ratifying	 them,	 and	 you	
have	 made	 Allah a	 Guarantor	 over	 you;	
indeed	Allah knows	your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Allāh	 kā	 ‘ahad	 poorā	 karo	 jab	 qaul	
bāñdho	 aur	 qasmeñ	 mazbooṭ karke	 na	
todo	aur	tum	Allāh	ko	apne	ūpar	zāmin	kar	chuke	ho	be-shak		Allāh	tumhāre	kām	jāntā	hai.

arabicText: وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّتِى نَقَضَتْ غَزْلَهَا مِنۢ بَعْدِ قُوَّةٍ أَنكَـٰثًۭا تَتَّخِذُونَ أَيْمَـٰنَكُمْ دَخَلًۢا بَيْنَكُمْ أَن تَكُونَ أُمَّةٌ هِىَ أَرْبَىٰ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ ۚ إِنَّمَا يَبْلُوكُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦ ۚ وَلَيُبَيِّنَنَّ لَكُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ مَا كُنتُمْ فِيهِ تَخْتَلِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 do	 not	 be	like	 the	woman broke	 her	
thread	into	bits	after	she	had	manufactured	it;	you	make	your	oaths	a	phoney	excuse	between	
yourselves	lest	one	nation	may	not	be	more	than	the	other;	Allah just	tries	you	with	it;	and	He	
will	surely	clarify	for	you	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection,	the	matters	in	which	you	differed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 us	 ‘aurat	 ki	ṭarah	 na	 ho	jis	 ne	apnā	 soot	mazbooṭi	 ke	 b’ad	 reza	 reza	 karke	 tod	 diyā	apni	
qasmeñ	āapas	meiñ	ek	be	asl	bahānā	banāte ho	ke	kahiñ	ek	giroh	doosre	giroh	se	ziyādah	na	ho	
Allāh	to	is	se	tumheñ	āazmātā	hai	aur	zaroor	tum	par	sāf	zāhir	kar	degā	qayāmat	ke	din	jis	bāt	
meiñ	jhagadte	they

arabicText: وَلَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَجَعَلَكُمْ أُمَّةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ وَلَـٰكِن يُضِلُّ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَلَتُسْـَٔلُنَّ عَمَّا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Had	Allah willed	He	would	have	made	you	all	one	nation,	but	He	sends	astray	whomever	He	wills	
and	guides	whomever	He	wills;	and	you	will	certainly	be	questioned	regarding	your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	chahtā	to	tum	ko	ek	hi	ummat	kartā	lekin	Allāh	jise	gumrāh	kartā	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	rāh	
detā	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	zaroor	tum	se	tumhāre	kām	pooche	jāyeñ	ge

arabicText: وَلَا تَتَّخِذُوٓا۟ أَيْمَـٰنَكُمْ دَخَلًۢا بَيْنَكُمْ فَتَزِلَّ قَدَمٌۢ بَعْدَ ثُبُوتِهَا وَتَذُوقُوا۟ ٱلسُّوٓءَ بِمَا صَدَدتُّمْ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَلَكُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 do	 not	 make	 your	 oaths	 phoney	
excuses	between	yourselves,	so	that	a	foot	
may	not	slip	after	being	steadfast	and	you	
may	 taste	 evil	 because	 you	 were	
preventing	from	Allah’s	way;	and	lest	you	
be	severely	punished.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apni	qasmeñ	āapas	meiñ	be	asl	bahānā	
na	banā	lo	ke	kahiñ	koi	pāoñ	jamne	ke	b’ad	
laghzish	na	kare	aur	tumheñ	burāi	chakhni	
ho	badlā	is	kā	ke	Allāh	ki	rāh	se	rokte	they	
aur	tumheñ	badā	‘aƶāb	ho

arabicText: وَلَا تَشْتَرُوا۟ بِعَهْدِ ٱللَّهِ ثَمَنًۭا قَلِيلًا ۚ إِنَّمَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	do	not	exchange	the	covenant	of	Allah
to	 procure	 an	 abject	 price;	 that	 which	 is	
with	Allah is	better	for	you,	if	you	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ke	‘ahad	par	thode	dām	mol	na	lo	
be-shak		woh	jo	Allāh	ke	pās	hai	tumhāre	
liye	behtar	hai	agar	tum	jānte	ho	.

arabicText: مَا عِندَكُمْ يَنفَدُ ۖ وَمَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ بَاقٍۢ ۗ وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوٓا۟ أَجْرَهُم بِأَحْسَنِ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
What	you	have	will	perish,	and	that	which	
is	 with	 Allah will	 remain	 forever;	 and	
indeed	We	shall	pay	the	patiently	enduring	
a	recompense	which	befits	the	best	of	their	
deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	tumhāre	pās	hai	ho	chuke	gā	aur	jo	Allāh	
ke	 pās	 hai	 hamesha	 rahne	 wālā	 hai	 aur	
zaroor	ham	sabr	karne	wāloñ	ko	un	kā	woh	
sila	deñ	ge	jo	un	ke	sab	se	achche	kām	ke	
qābil	ho

arabicText: مَنْ عَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا مِّن ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنثَىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌۭ فَلَنُحْيِيَنَّهُۥ حَيَوٰةًۭ طَيِّبَةًۭ ۖ وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْرَهُم بِأَحْسَنِ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	 does	 good	 deeds	 - whether	 a	
male	or	female	- and	is	a	Muslim,	We	shall	
sustain	 him	 an	 excellent	 life,	 and	 shall	
certainly	 pay	 them	 a	 recompense	 which	
befits	the	best	of	their	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	achchā	kām	kare	mard	ho	yā	‘aurat	aur	
ho	Musalmān	to	zaroor	ham	usey		achchhi	
zindagi	jilāyeñ	ge	aur	zaroor	unheñ	un	kā	
neg	(Ajr)	deñ	ge	jo	un	ke	sab	se	behtar	kām	ke	lāiq	ho

arabicText: فَإِذَا قَرَأْتَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ فَٱسْتَعِذْ بِٱللَّهِ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	you	recite	the	Qur’an,	seek	the	
refuge	of	Allah from	Satan	the	outcast.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	jab	tum	Qur'ān	padho	to	Allāh	ki	panāh	māñgo	shaiṭān		mardood	se

arabicText: إِنَّهُۥ لَيْسَ لَهُۥ سُلْطَـٰنٌ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	he	has	no	power	over	the	believers	
and	who	rely	only	upon	their	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		us	kā	koi	qāboo	un	par	nahiñ	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	apne	Rab	hi	par	bharosā	rakhte	haiñ

arabicText: إِنَّمَا سُلْطَـٰنُهُۥ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ يَتَوَلَّوْنَهُۥ وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِهِۦ مُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Satan’s	power	is	only	over	those	who	make	
friendship	with	him	and	ascribe	him	as	a	partner	(in	worship).
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	kā	qāboo	to	unhiñ	par	hai	jo	us se	dosti	karte	haiñ	aur	usey		sharik	thehrāte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَإِذَا بَدَّلْنَآ ءَايَةًۭ مَّكَانَ ءَايَةٍۢ ۙ وَٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُنَزِّلُ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُفْتَرٍۭ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	We	replace	a	verse	*	by	another	- and	Allah well	knows	what	He	sends	down	- the	
disbelievers say,	“You	are	just	fabricating”;	in	fact	most	of	them	do	not	know.	(* The command 
of one verse by another.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	ham	ek	āayat	ki	jagah	doosri	āayat	badleñ	aur	Allāh	khoob	jāntā	hai	jo	utārtā	hai	kāfir	
kaheñ	tum	dil	se	banā	lāte	ho	balke	un	meiñ	aksar	ko	ìlm	nahiñ

arabicText: قُلْ نَزَّلَهُۥ رُوحُ ٱلْقُدُسِ مِن رَّبِّكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ لِيُثَبِّتَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَهُدًۭى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“The	Holy	Spirit	*	has	rightly	brought	it	down	from	your	Lord,	to	make	the	believers	
steadfast,	and	a	guidance	and	glad	tidings	for	the	Muslims.”	(*	Angel	Jibreel	- peace	and	blessings	
be	upon	him.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	isey		pakizgi	ki	rooh	ne	utārā	tumhāre	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	se	thik	thik	ke	is	se	imān	wāloñ	
ko	sābit	qadam	kare	aur	hidāyat	aur	bashārat	Musalmānoñ	ko.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ إِنَّمَا يُعَلِّمُهُۥ بَشَرٌۭ ۗ لِّسَانُ ٱلَّذِى يُلْحِدُونَ إِلَيْهِ أَعْجَمِىٌّۭ وَهَـٰذَا لِسَانٌ عَرَبِىٌّۭ مُّبِينٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed We	know	that	they	say,	“This	
Qur’an	 is	 being	 taught	 by	 some	 other	
man”;	 the	 one	 they	 refer	 to	 speaks	 a	
foreign	 language,	 whereas	 this	 is	 clear	
Arabic!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak		ham	jānte	haiñ	ke	woh	kahte		
haiñ yeh	to	koi	āadmi sikhātā	hai	jis	ki	ṭaraf	
dhālte	 (Ishāra)	 haiñ	 us	 ki	 zabān	Ajmi	 hai	
aur	yeh	raushan	Arabi	zabān

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ لَا يَهْدِيهِمُ ٱللَّهُ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	disbelieve	in	the	signs	of	Allah
- Allah does	not	guide	them,	and	for	them	
is	a	punishment,	most	painful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		woh	jo	Allāh	ki	Āyatoñ	par	Imān	
nahiñ	lāte	Allāh	unheñ	rāh	nahiñ	detā	aur	
un	ke	liye	dard-nāk	‘aƶāb	hai

arabicText: إِنَّمَا يَفْتَرِى ٱلْكَذِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْكَـٰذِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Only	 those	 who	 do	 not	 believe	 in	Allah’s	
signs	 attribute	 lies	 and	 fabrications;	 and	
they	themselves	are	liars.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jhoot	buhtān	wohi		bāndhte	haiñ	jo	Allāh	ki	
āayatoñ	 par	Imān	 nahiñ	 rakhte	 aur	 wohi		
jhoote	haiñ.

arabicText: مَن كَفَرَ بِٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ إِيمَـٰنِهِۦٓ إِلَّا مَنْ أُكْرِهَ وَقَلْبُهُۥ مُطْمَئِنٌّۢ بِٱلْإِيمَـٰنِ وَلَـٰكِن مَّن شَرَحَ بِٱلْكُفْرِ صَدْرًۭا فَعَلَيْهِمْ غَضَبٌۭ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
The	 one	 who	 disbelieves	 in	 Allah after	
accepting	faith	- except	him	who	is	forced	
to	and	whose	heart	is	still	firmly	upon	faith	
- but	 whoever	 is	 wholeheartedly	 a	
disbeliever,	 upon	 them	 is	 the	 wrath	 of	
Allah;	and	for	them	is	a	great	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	Imān	lā	kar	Allāh	kā	munkir	ho	siwā	us	
ke	jo	majboor	kiyā	jāye	aur	us	kā	dil	Imān	
par	jamā	 huā	 ho	 hāñ	 woh	jo	 dil	 khol	 kar	
kāfir	ho	un	par	Allāh	kā	ghazab	hai	aur	un	
ko	badā	‘aƶāb	hai	.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمُ ٱسْتَحَبُّوا۟ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا عَلَى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	because	the	worldly	life	was	dearer	
to	 them	 than	 the	 Hereafter;	 and	 because	
Allah does	 not	 guide	 such	 disbelieving	
people.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	is	liye	ke	unhoñ	ne	dunyā	ki	zindagi	āakhirat		se	piyāri	jāni	aur	is	liye	ke	Allāh	(aise)	kāfiroñ	
ko	rāh	nahiñ	detā

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ طَبَعَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ وَسَمْعِهِمْ وَأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْغَـٰفِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
These	are	the	ones	whose	hearts,	ears,	and	
eyes	 Allah has	 sealed;	 and	 they	 are	 the	
neglectful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	haiñ	woh	jin	ke	dil	aur	kān	aur	āañkhoñ	par	Allāh	ne	mohar	kar	di	hai	aur	wohi	ghaflat	mein	
pade	haiñ

arabicText: لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: So	it	occurred	that	they	are	the	losers	in	the	Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText: Āap hi	huā	ke	āakhirat meiñ	wohi		kharāb	haiñ

arabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا فُتِنُوا۟ ثُمَّ جَـٰهَدُوا۟ وَصَبَرُوٓا۟ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا لَغَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Then	indeed	your	Lord	- for	those	who	migrated	after	they had	been	oppressed,	and	then	fought	
and	remained	patient	- indeed	your	Lord	is	then,	surely,	Oft	Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	be-shak tumhārā	Rab	un	ke	liye	jinhoñ	ne	apne	ghar	chorde	b’ad	iske	ke	satāye	gaye	phir	
unhoñ	ne	Jihād	kiyā	aur	Sābir	rahe	be-shak tumhārā	Rab	is	ke	b’ād	zaroor	bakhsh	ne	wālā	hai	
maherbān

arabicText: ۞ يَوْمَ تَأْتِى كُلُّ نَفْسٍۢ تُجَـٰدِلُ عَن نَّفْسِهَا وَتُوَفَّىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍۢ مَّا عَمِلَتْ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	 day	 when	 every	 soul	 will	 come	
quarrelling	 against	 itself,	 and	 every	 soul	
will	be	fully	repaid	for	what	it	did,	and	they	
will	not	be	wronged.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	har	jān	apni	hi	ṭaraf	jhagadti	āaye	gi	
aur	har	jān	ko	us	kā	kiyā	poorā	bhar	diyā	
jāye	gā	aur	un	par	ƶulm	na	hogā

arabicText: وَضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًۭا قَرْيَةًۭ كَانَتْ ءَامِنَةًۭ مُّطْمَئِنَّةًۭ يَأْتِيهَا رِزْقُهَا رَغَدًۭا مِّن كُلِّ مَكَانٍۢ فَكَفَرَتْ بِأَنْعُمِ ٱللَّهِ فَأَذَٰقَهَا ٱللَّهُ لِبَاسَ ٱلْجُوعِ وَٱلْخَوْفِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَصْنَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah has	illustrated	an	example	of	a	
township	 - which	 dwelt	 in	 peace	 and	
security,	 its	 provisions	 coming	 in	
abundance	 from	 every	 side	- in	 response	
the	 township	 started	 being	 ungrateful	 of	
Allah’s	 favours,	 therefore	 Allah made	 it	
taste	the	punishment	by	covering	it	with	a	
cloak	of	starvation	and	fear,	on	account	of	
their	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Allāh	 ne	 kahāwat	 bayān	 farmāi	 ek	
basti	ke	amān-o-iṭminān	se	thi har	ṭaraf	se	
us	 ki	 rozi	 kasrat	 se	 āati	 to	 woh	 Allāh	 ki	
ne’matoñ		ki	nā	shukri	karne	lagi	to	Allāh	
ne	usey		yeh	sazā	chakhāi	ke	usey		bhook	
aur	dar	kā	pehnāwā	pahnāyā	badlā	un	ke	
kiye	kā.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُمْ رَسُولٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَهُمْ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 indeed	 a	 Noble	 Messenger	 came	 to	
them	from	among	them	- in	response	they	
denied	him,	and	therefore	the	punishment	
seized	them,	and	they	were	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 un	 ke	 pās	 unhiñ	 meiñ	 se	 ek	 Rasool
tashrif	lāyā	 to	unhoñ	ne	usey	 jhutlāyā	 to	
unheñ	 ‘aƶāb	 ne	 pakdā	 aur	 woh	 be	 insāf	
they.

arabicText: فَكُلُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ حَلَـٰلًۭا طَيِّبًۭا وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ إِيَّاهُ تَعْبُدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	 eat	 the	 lawful	 and	 good	
sustenance	Allah has	provided	you,	and	be	
grateful	 for	 the	 blessings	 of	 your	 Lord,	if	
you	worship	Him
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Allāh	ki	di	huyi	rozi	halāl	pakiza	khāo	
aur	Allāh	ki	ne’mat		kā	shukr	karo	agar	tum	
usey		poojte	ho.

arabicText: إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْمَيْتَةَ وَٱلدَّمَ وَلَحْمَ ٱلْخِنزِيرِ وَمَآ أُهِلَّ لِغَيْرِ ٱللَّهِ بِهِۦ ۖ فَمَنِ ٱضْطُرَّ غَيْرَ بَاغٍۢ وَلَا عَادٍۢ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Only	 these	 are	 forbidden	 for	 you	 - the	
carrion,	and	blood,	and	flesh	of	swine,	and	
that	 which	 has	 been	 slaughtered	 while	
proclaiming	the	name	of	any	other	besides	
Allah;	so	one	who	is	compelled	and	does	not	eat	out	of	desire,	nor	more	than	what	is	necessary,	
then	indeed	Allah is	Oft	Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	par	to	yahi	harām	kiyā	hai	murdār	aur	khoon	aur	sooar	ka gosht	aur	woh	jis	ke	żibah	karte	
waqt	ghair-e-khudā	 ka nām	 pukārā	gayā	 phir	jo	lāchār	 ho	 na	 khuwāhish	 kartā	aur	 na	 had	 se	
badhtā	to	be-shak		Allāh	bakhsh	ne	wālā	maherbān		hai.

arabicText: وَلَا تَقُولُوا۟ لِمَا تَصِفُ أَلْسِنَتُكُمُ ٱلْكَذِبَ هَـٰذَا حَلَـٰلٌۭ وَهَـٰذَا حَرَامٌۭ لِّتَفْتَرُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفْتَرُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ لَا يُفْلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	do	not	say	- the	lie	which	your	tongues	speak	- “This	is	lawful,	and	this	is	forbidden”	in	order	
to	fabricate	a	lie	against	Allah;	indeed	those	who	fabricate	lies	against	Allah will	never	prosper.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	na	kaho	usey jo	tumhāri	zabāneñ	jhoot	bayān	karti	haiñ	yeh	Halāl	hai	aur	yeh	Harām	hai	ke	
Allāh	par	jhoot	bāndho	be-shak		jo	Allāh	par	jhoot	bāñdhte	haiñ	un	kā	bhalā	na	hogā.

arabicText: وَمَتَـٰعٌۭ قَلِيلٌۭ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText: A	little	enjoyment	- and	for	them	is	a	punishment,	most	painful.
romanUrduTranslationText: Thodā	baratnā	hai	aur	un	ke	liye	dard-nāk	‘aƶāb

arabicText: وَعَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ هَادُوا۟ حَرَّمْنَا مَا قَصَصْنَا عَلَيْكَ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ وَمَا ظَلَمْنَـٰهُمْ وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	especially	for	the	Jews	We	forbade	which	We	related	to	you	earlier;	and	We	did	not	oppress	
them,	but	it	is	they	who	wronged	themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	khās	Yahudiyoñ	par	Ham	ne	Harām	farmāiñ	woh	chizeñ	jo	pahle tumheñ	sunāyiñ	aur	Ham	
ne	un	par	ƶulm	na	kiyā	hāñ	wohi apni	jānoñ par	ƶulm	karte	haiñ

arabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا۟ ٱلسُّوٓءَ بِجَهَـٰلَةٍۢ ثُمَّ تَابُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ وَأَصْلَحُوٓا۟ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا لَغَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
Then	 indeed	 your	 Lord	 - for	 those	 who	
unwittingly	 commit	 evil	 and	 then	 repent	
and	reform	themselves	- indeed	your	Lord	
is	 then,	 surely,	 Oft	 Forgiving,	 Most	
Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	 be-shak tumhārā	 Rab	 un	 ke	 liye	 jo	
nādāni	 se	 burāyi	 kar	 baitheñ	 phir	 us	 ke	
b’ad	 taubā	 kareñ	 sañwar	 jāyeñ	 be-shak		
tumhārā	Rab	 iske	 b’ad	 zaroor bakhsh	 ne	
wālā	maherbān		hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ كَانَ أُمَّةًۭ قَانِتًۭا لِّلَّهِ حَنِيفًۭا وَلَمْ يَكُ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 Ibrahim	was	a	leader,	obedient	 to	
Allah,	 and	 detached	 from	 all;	 and	 he	was	
not	a	polytheist.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	 Ibrāhim ek	 Imām	 thā	 Allāh	 kā	
farmāñ	bardār	aur	sab	se	judā	aur	mushrik	
na	thā

arabicText: شَاكِرًۭا لِّأَنْعُمِهِ ۚ ٱجْتَبَىٰهُ وَهَدَىٰهُ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍۢ مُّسْتَقِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Grateful	for	His	blessings;	Allah chose	him	
and	guided	him	to	the	Straight	Path.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ke	ehsānoñ	par	shukr	karne	wālā	Allāh	
ne	usey chun	liyā	aur	usey sidhi	rāh	dikhāi.

arabicText: وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةًۭ ۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	usey		dunyā	meiñ	bhalāi	di	aur	
be-shak woh	 āakhirat	 	 meiñ	 Shāyān-eQurb	ha

arabicText: ثُمَّ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْكَ أَنِ ٱتَّبِعْ مِلَّةَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ حَنِيفًۭا ۖ وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 then	 We	 sent	 you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	the	divine	revelation	that,	“Follow	the	
religion	of	Ibrahim,	who	was	free	from	all	
falsehood;	and	was	not	a	polytheist.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	ham	ne	tumheñ	waḥi	bheji	ke	Deen-eIbrahim ki	perwi	karo	jo	har	baṭil	se	alag	
thā	aur	mushrik	na	thā

arabicText: إِنَّمَا جُعِلَ ٱلسَّبْتُ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ فِيهِ ۚ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَحْكُمُ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فِيمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	 Sabbath	 was	 made	 obligatory	 only	
upon	those	who	differed	in	it;	and	indeed	
your	Lord	will	judge	between	them	on	the	
Day	of	Resurrection	concerning	the	matter	
in	which	they	differed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Haftā	 to	 unhiñ	 par	 rakhā	 gayā	 thā	 jo	 is	
meiñ	mukhtalif		ho	gaye	aur	be-shak		tumhārā	Rab	qiyāmat	ke	din	un	meiñ	faislā	kar	dega	jis	bāt	
meiñ	ikhtilāf	karte	they

arabicText: ٱدْعُ إِلَىٰ سَبِيلِ رَبِّكَ بِٱلْحِكْمَةِ وَٱلْمَوْعِظَةِ ٱلْحَسَنَةِ ۖ وَجَـٰدِلْهُم بِٱلَّتِى هِىَ أَحْسَنُ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ ۖ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Call	 towards	 the	 path	 of	 your	 Lord	 with	
sound	 planning	 and	 good	 advice,	 and	
debate	with	them	in	the	best	possible	way;	indeed	your	Lord	well	knows	him	who	has	strayed	
from	His	path,	and	He	well	knows	the	guided
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apne	Rab	ki	rāh	ki	ṭaraf	bulāo	pakki	tadbir	aur	achchhi	nasihat	se	aur	un	se	is	us	tariqe	par	bahes	
karo	jo	sab	se	behtar	ho	be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	khoob	jāntā	hai	jo	us	ki	rāh	se	behkā	aur	woh	khoob	
jāntā	hai	rāh	wāloñ	ko

arabicText: وَإِنْ عَاقَبْتُمْ فَعَاقِبُوا۟ بِمِثْلِ مَا عُوقِبْتُم بِهِۦ ۖ وَلَئِن صَبَرْتُمْ لَهُوَ خَيْرٌۭ لِّلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	you	mete	out	punishment,	then	punish	similarly	as	you	were	afflicted;	and	if	you	patiently	
endure,	then	indeed	patience	is	better	for	the	patiently	enduring.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tum	sazā	do	to	waisi	hi	sazā	do	jaisi	taklif	tumheñ	pahuñchāyi	thi	aur	agar	tum	sabr	karo	
to	be-shak sabr	wāloñ	ko	sabr	sab	se	achchā

arabicText: وَٱصْبِرْ وَمَا صَبْرُكَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ ۚ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا تَكُ فِى ضَيْقٍۢ مِّمَّا يَمْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	patiently	endure	- and	your	
patience	 is	 only	 due	 to	 the	 guidance	 of	 Allah - and	 do	 not	 grieve	 for	 them,	 and	 do	 not	 be	
disheartened	by	their	deceits.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	Mehboob!	Tum	sabr	karo	aur	tumhārā	sabr	Allāh	hi	ki	taufeeq	se	hai	aur	un	kā	gham	na	
khāo	aur	un	ke	fareboñ	se	dil	tang	na	ho

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ وَّٱلَّذِينَ هُم مُّحْسِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	Allah is	with	the	pious	and	the	virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		Allāh	un	ke	sāth	hai	jo	darte	haiñ	aur	jo	nekiyān	karte	haiñ.
